concise_definition: n. 油门, 节流阀; v. 控制, 限制, 勒住

definitions.explanation_en: A valve or device that regulates the flow of fuel or air into an engine, thereby controlling its power output.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种调节进入发动机的燃料或空气流量的阀门或装置，从而控制其动力输出。
definitions.example_en: He pushed the throttle forward to increase the speed of the boat.
definitions.example_cn: 他向前推动油门以提高船速。

definitions.explanation_en: A metaphorical or figurative control mechanism that restricts or limits the intensity, growth, or activity of something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 比喻性地指限制某事物强度、增长或活动的机制。
definitions.example_en: The government imposed a throttle on public spending to reduce the deficit.
definitions.example_cn: 政府对公共支出实施了限制，以减少财政赤字。

definitions.explanation_en: To control or reduce the power, speed, or intensity of something, especially an engine or system.
definitions.explanation_cn: 控制或降低某物（尤其是发动机或系统）的功率、速度或强度。
definitions.example_en: The pilot throttled back the engines to slow down during landing.
definitions.example_cn: 飞行员在着陆时减小了发动机推力以减速。

definitions.explanation_en: To restrict or suppress something forcefully, often to the point of stifling or choking.
definitions.explanation_cn: 强行限制或压制某事物，常达到窒息或扼杀的程度。
definitions.example_en: The new regulations are throttling innovation in the tech sector.
definitions.example_cn: 新法规正在扼杀科技领域的创新。

comparison.analysis: “Restrict” (限制) 是一个更通用的词，泛指对范围、数量或行为施加限制，不特指动力或流量控制。而 “throttle” 更强调通过物理或机制性手段主动降低强度，常带有突然或剧烈的控制意味，尤其在工程或经济语境中更具形象性。
“Constrain” (约束) 侧重于外部条件或规则对自由或行动的限制，常含被动或被迫的意味。而 “throttle” 更强调主动施加压力以压制或减速，常用于描述对能量、增长或进程的直接干预，语气更强烈。
“Regulate” (调节) 指使某事物保持在稳定或期望的范围内，通常是持续、精细的调整。而 “throttle” 更倾向于大幅降低或突然限制，常用于紧急或过度状态下的干预，调节的精度较低但力度更大。
